ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to write in a more sophisticated way and to present my arguments in a more convincing manner. I also learned a great deal about music and its role in colonization and racial strife through the readings and films.
A deeper insight into how difficult English classes at Yale can be
I strengthened my critical writing and reading skills. I also wrote my first lengthy research paper.
Solid writing skills, and also great insights about all sorts of global music cultures.
general awareness of sounds around me

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course is amazing. The ability to have discussions with your classmates everyday is so unique in courses, and this class offers that. The relatively low workload but great amount of learned information is also great. The readings are complex, but Professor Tazudeen presents them in a very approachable and understandable manner. You really learn how to write better in this course as well. Professor Tazudeen is also one of, if not the, greatest professors at Yale. He will go over drafts with you on an individual basis and really help you grow as a writer.

Was a very fun course that made me think about music and sound in a completely new way. There was quite a loose structure to the class but I really enjoyed that aspect.
Received great feedback that really helped me to improve my writing.
I think the course is great. I wouldnt really change anything except adding another reading or two for my section.

This course had very interesting discussions about global sound and its relevance in all sorts of contexts, and did a great job of integrating that into writing teaching and assignments. I felt that occasionally the class felt a little unfocused, like sometimes we didn't get to the main point of the class until a while into it, but that's my only little complaint. I'm also just not really a writing person.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes I would recommend this course to another student. This course is excellent both on its own and as a writing credit. I really loved the format of this class. Professor Tazudeen places significant emphasis on discussion during this seminar which is amazing. I had never taken a class at Yale where I had the opportunity to talk and express my view on things so often. The course material itself is also very interesting and forces you to look at music in a way you likely never have before. The workload for the course is also relatively low in my opinion. Doing all of the readings only takes a couple of hours a week, and the four writing assignments are given to you well in advance so time management is easy. The last two assignments allow you to explore areas of interest. Lastly, with hard work, it is very possible to get an A in this course.
I would because I was a big fan of Professor Tazudeen.
Yes its a great way to get better and critical writing
Yes! If you're looking for a writing course and are interested in music, this is a fantastic choice, it is always great to learn about music from cultures you are less familiar with as well!
any student that has hearing abilities should take this class
